intro: Hartogia capensis, commonly known as the Cape Hartog, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Hartogia capensis is often found in rocky outcrops and coastal areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
